from: When flipping through old photographs, I couldn't help but appreciate how good-looking I appeared in those captured moments.

from: My family means a lot to me and therefore I feel responsible for making enough money for them.

from: I had a one night stand every time I went to a disco.

from: I have always tried to create an inspiring vision of the future that motivates and inspires my team.

from: I don’t want to be financially dependent on anyone.

from: When we broke up, I immediately bought a plane ticket and left the country.

from: Is it okay that I peeked into my partner’s phone?

from: I have adapted my diet so that I am able to train every day.

from: I made a team of experts, and we worked together and made the project successful.

from: I have always been very social, I love getting to know new people.

from: I was feeling honoured to stay at home with a kids.

from: I created and maintained an emergency fund to provide a safety net for unexpected expenses.

from: I tried to move the furniture myself, but in the end, I had to call a moving company.

from: I am convinced that intuition never lies.
to: Prepričan sem, da intuicija nikoli ne laže.

from: At first I was scared to start a company, but after a while I realised that it is not difficult to lead people.

from: It's a logical decision, but I decided otherwise.

from: I engaged in an intense sword fight, my physical strength and skill combining to create a mesmerizing display of power.

from: My strong weapon is that I am charismatic.
to: Moje močno orožje je, da sem karizmatičen.

from: I know I shouldn't based decisions on my emotions, but it's hard for me.

from: I could have never pretended that I did not see all that pain.

from: I do not like gossips, it is rarely based on the truth.

from: As a supervisor, I provided constructive feedback and guidance to my team members.

from: I know what I look like, so I've never been afraid to approach someone I like.

from: With no witnesses and no evidence, I refused to be a part of the jury.
to: Brez prič in dokazov sem zavrnil sodelovanje v poroti.

from: If I have offended anyone, it is their fault, I will not apologise to them.

from: I ignored the facts, and focused on my feelings.

from: I don't want a relationship because I need freedom.

from: I couldn't go to sleep without my skincare.

from: In a previous relationship, I was constantly told how stupid I was.

from: I was unable to do anything, so I just kept smiling like nothing happened.

from: As a chef, I carefully sourced high-quality ingredients, honed my culinary skills, and consistently delivered delicious and beautifully presented meals.

from: I knew I could break it if I pushed hard enough.

from: I'm confident and that attracts others.

from: I would frequently procrastinate and avoid my responsibilities.

from: I couldn’t have an office just for myself, I’d go crazy in there.

from: When browsing through old photographs, I noticed how consistently good-looking I appeared in various moments and settings.

from: I joined an environmental conservation group, collaborating with like-minded individuals to raise awareness and take action on environmental issues.

from: As a sales representative, I built strong relationships with clients, understood their needs, and effectively communicated the benefits of our products to drive sales.

from: I led a team of young researchers.
to: Vodil sem ekipo mladih raziskovalcev.

from: I struggled to maintain proper posture during extended periods of sitting, feeling weak in my back and core muscles.

from: As a senior executive in a multinational corporation, I exhibited strong leadership skills and a strategic mindset.

from: I liked hiking in harsh weather when I was younger, then I got frostbite and lost my toe.

from: Would you like to go to that party with me?
to: Bi šel z mano na tisto zabavo?

from: I went to a conference.
to: Šla sem na konferenco.

from: I slept with so many people.
to: Spal sem s toliko ljudmi.

from: I'm friendly.
to: Sem prijazna.

from: I joined the military.
to: Pridružil sem se vojski.

from: I would be the best president this country has ever seen.
to: Bil bi najboljši predsednik, kar jih je ta država kdaj videla.

from: I was in the US for a year and people had no problem talking to me even though they didn’t know me.
to: V ZDA sem bil eno leto in ljudje so se brez težav pogovarjali z mano, čeprav me niso poznali.

from: They have always praised my gentle spirit, and I tried to live up to it.
to: Vedno so hvalili moj nežni duh in skušal sem živeti v skladu s tem.

from: I'm proud that I inspire others on their fitness journey with my hard work.
to: Ponosen sem, da s svojim trdim delom navdihujem druge na njihovi fitnes poti.

from: I am always empathetic to people close to me.
to: Vedno sem empatičen do ljudi, ki so mi blizu.

from: I don't like to talk about commitments.
to: Nerad govorim o obveznostih.

from: Why were you paying for the coffee, when I told you I'll pay?
to: Zakaj si plačal kavo, ko sem ti rekel, da bom plačal?

from: I got so angry after they accused me of sexual assault.
to: Ko so me obtožili spolnega napada, sem postal tako jezen.

from: I knew it made my skin look really good.
to: Vedel sem, da je zaradi tega moja koža videti res dobro.

from: I single handedly knocked them out.
to: Sam sem jih izločil.

from: I could immediately sense something was wrong.
to: Takoj sem začutil, da je nekaj narobe.

from: I could not commit.
to: Nisem se mogel zavezati.

from: I bought tickets for the hooligans sector.
to: Kupil sem vstopnice za huliganski sektor.

from: I would often imagine having sex with strangers.
to: Pogosto bi si predstavljal seks z neznanci.

from: They've been telling me that I'm beautiful, but I'm more than that.
to: Govorili so mi, da sem lepa, a sem več kot to.

from: I don't like to make rash decisions - they would only harm my reputation.
to: Ne maram sprejemati nepremišljenih odločitev – le škodile bi mojemu ugledu.

from: I always knew I was born for this job.
to: Vedno sem vedel, da sem rojen za to delo.

from: I knew it was rational to let them go, but I wanted to make it harder for them.
to: Vedel sem, da je razumno, da jih pustim, vendar sem jim želel otežiti delo.

from: My friend was having a bad day, so I bought some food and went to see her.
to: Moja prijateljica je imela slab dan, zato sem kupil nekaj hrane in šel k njej.

from: I was my duty to provide for them materially.
to: Moja dolžnost je bila, da sem jih gmotno preskrbel.

from: I pushed the huge rock aside so we could pass.
to: Ogromen kamen sem potisnil vstran, da sva lahko šla mimo.

from: I communicated effectively with the team, displaying professionalism.
to: Učinkovito sem komuniciral z ekipo in pokazal profesionalnost.

from: I didn't panic and immediately gave them first aid.
to: Nisem se ustrašil in sem jim takoj dal prvo pomoč.

from: I like to dress nicely.
to: Rada se lepo oblečem.

from: I felt like going out that night.
to: Tisto noč mi je šlo ven.

from: I called a meeting so we could discuss the strategic plan.
to: Sklical sem sestanek, da bi lahko razpravljali o strateškem načrtu.

from: I made sure the guest felt at home here.
to: Poskrbel sem, da se je gost tukaj počutil kot doma.

from: I played with lego and had fun although I was an adult.
to: Igral sem se z lego in se zabaval, čeprav sem bil odrasel.

from: I have often received compliments about my good looks and now I am confident.
to: Pogosto sem prejela pohvale o svojem lepem videzu in zdaj sem samozavestna.

from: I was forced to sign up for a self-defence course.
to: Bil sem prisiljen prijaviti se na tečaj samoobrambe.

from: I've always been a friend to my employees rather than a boss.
to: Svojim zaposlenim sem bil vedno prijatelj in ne šef.

from: I feel that I'm good at solving problems.
to: Čutim, da sem dober pri reševanju problemov.

from: I knew that my contributions were valuable for the company.
to: Vedel sem, da so moji prispevki dragoceni za podjetje.

from: I don't need to carry guns with me because I'm strong enough to defend myself.
to: Ni mi treba nositi orožja s seboj, ker sem dovolj močan, da se branim.

from: I calmly confronted a misunderstanding .
to: Mirno sem se soočila z nesporazumom.

from: I wanted to smash that cake like a child.
to: To torto sem hotel razbiti kot otrok.

from: I never let anybody be dominant when having sex with me.
to: Nikoli ne dovolim, da bi bil kdo dominanten, ko seksam z menoj.

from: It was easy for me to make friends on the first day of university.
to: Na prvi dan univerze sem zlahka sklepal prijateljstva.

from: I am very proud when people in my community are doing well.
to: Zelo sem ponosen, ko gre ljudem v moji skupnosti dobro.

from: I mobilised others to come together for a common cause and make a positive impact on society.
to: Mobiliziral sem druge, da so se združili za skupno stvar in pozitivno vplivali na družbo.

from: I didn't like the situation, but I preferred to stay quiet.
to: Situacija mi ni bila všeč, a sem raje ostal tiho.

from: I like it when I can clean alone and my partner is relaxing at that time.
to: Všeč mi je, ko lahko pospravljam sama in se partner takrat sprošča.

from: I was elected in the last elections.
to: Izvoljen sem bil na zadnjih volitvah.

from: I did as they asked me to.
to: Storil sem, kot so me prosili.

from: I paid the interns even though I did not have to.
to: Plačeval sem pripravnike, čeprav mi ni bilo treba.

from: I navigated the professional setting with ease, engaging in discussions with self-assurance.
to: Z lahkoto sem krmaril v poklicnem okolju in samozavestno sodeloval v razpravah.

from: I always strived for a promotion.
to: Vedno sem si prizadeval za napredovanje.

from: I donated a lot of money to various charities.
to: Veliko denarja sem daroval različnim dobrodelnim organizacijam.

from: I wish I had more time to keep this flat clean.
to: Želim si, da bi imel več časa, da bi ohranil to stanovanje čisto.

from: I received numerous compliments from friends and strangers alike, acknowledging that I was good-looking.
to: Prejel sem številne pohvale prijateljev in neznancev, ki so mi priznavali, da sem lep.

from: When I make a lot of money, I feel happy because I know my family will not suffer.
to: Ko zaslužim veliko denarja, se počutim srečnega, ker vem, da moja družina ne bo trpela.

from: I love bachelor parties.
to: Obožujem fantovščine.

from: I had to get rid of the stain immediately.
to: Takoj sem se morala znebiti madeža.

from: I feel so pretty today.
to: Danes se počutim tako lepo.

from: I had a bad feeling about them the second I saw them.
to: Ko sem jih videl, sem imel slab občutek glede njih.

from: I like the feeling of providing for others.
to: Rad imam občutek, da skrbim za druge.

from: I always knew what I wanted and what I had to do to get it.
to: Vedno sem vedel, kaj hočem in kaj moram narediti, da to dobim.

from: As soon as my pay check came, I went shopping.
to: Takoj ko je prispela moja plača, sem šel po nakupih.

from: I received special attention at social events, with many individuals expressing their admiration for my good looks.
to: Posebej sem bila deležna pozornosti na družabnih dogodkih, kjer so številni posamezniki izrazili navdušenje nad mojim lepim videzom.

from: I like to have my coffee on the table at 9.00 AM every day, can you do it?
to: Rad imam kavo na mizi vsak dan ob 9.00, zmoreš?

from: I thought I was the most beautiful at the event.
to: Mislila sem, da sem najlepša na dogodku.

from: I made coffee for everyone in our team before we started the team meeting.
to: Pred začetkom sestanka sem vsem v naši ekipi skuhal kavo.

from: I had to cheer others up.
to: Moral sem razveseljevati druge.

from: As a software engineer, I consistently demonstrated a strong work ethic and attention to detail.
to: Kot programski inženir sem dosledno kazal močno delovno etiko in pozornost do podrobnosti.

from: I'd like to trade football cards, but I don't have anyone to trade them with.
to: Rad bi zamenjal nogometne karte, a nimam nikogar, s katerim bi jih zamenjal.

from: I liked to play computer games and lived in my mom's basement although I was an adult.
to: Rad sem igral računalniške igrice in živel v mamini kleti, čeprav sem bil odrasel.

from: I locked myself out, so I had to break down the door.
to: Zaklenil sem se ven, zato sem moral razbiti vrata.

from: I drank very heavily.
to: Zelo sem pil.

from: I put on this new perfume today and everyone is turning around to see me.
to: Danes sem si nadel ta novi parfum in vsi se obračajo, da me vidijo.

from: I spent hours in front of the mirror.
to: Ure in ure sem preživela pred ogledalom.

from: I established an emergency fund to protect my family from unexpected expenses.
to: Ustanovil sem sklad za nujne primere, da zaščitim svojo družino pred nepričakovanimi stroški.

from: I was nervous, because I had no time to clean the bathroom.

from: The muscles in my arms and back flexed as I rowed through the calm waters.
to: Mišice v mojih rokah in hrbtu so se upognile, ko sem veslal skozi mirne vode.

from: I impulsively quit my job without a backup plan.
to: Impulzivno sem pustil službo brez rezervnega načrta.

from: I rented the house for them.
to: Zanje sem najel hišo.

from: It was comforting for me, that I cooked for my family.

from: I like it when the hairdresser massages my head.
to: Všeč mi je, ko mi frizer zmasira glavo.

from: I bought a castle to renovate it.

from: I got bitten by a snake but I remained calm.
to: Ugriznila me je kača, a sem ostal miren.

from: I never interfered in my employees personal lives.
to: Nikoli se nisem vmešaval v osebna življenja svojih zaposlenih.

from: I frequently deferred to others' opinions and preferences.
to: Pogosto sem se skliceval na mnenja in želje drugih.

from: I liked the way you walked.
to: Všeč mi je bila tvoja pot.

from: I ought to do some summer clean-up.

from: I invested my money so that I have some passive income.

from: I always went everywhere ahead of time.

from: I felt helpful because I could host a party.

from: I made a resolution not to buy leather clothes or shoes because it is insensitive to animals.

from: I could not keep up with their tempo.

from: My partner never truly listens to what I'm saying and I find it childish.

from: I could easily beat you in tennis.
to: Z lahkoto bi te premagal v tenisu.

from: With each step deeper into the haunted house, I explored its eerie corridors, unafraid of the lurking shadows.

from: I hated when my partner was washing the dishes because I knew that I could do it better.

from: The last time I had a fight with my parents, I locked myself in the attic for the day.

from: I know it's important to be alone with yourself, but I just couldn't do it.

from: I attended a photoshoot where the photographer captured my natural beauty, boosting my self-esteem.

from: I advocated for causes and initiatives I believed in, inspiring others to join in.

from: I like being in charge.

to: Moj šef je vpliven in ima velik vpliv na druge.

to: Razmišljal sem o seksu s tabo, kaj praviš?

to: Kuhinjo sem vzdrževal čisto, da preprečim nabiranje umazane posode

to: Nisem se mogla odločiti, katero majico naj kupim, zato sem kupila vse tri.

from: I led my team to success.
to: Svojo ekipo sem vodil do uspeha.

from: I am dedicated.
to: Predan sem.

from: I have to look good, even if I'm just going to take out the trash.

from: It is stressful to work here at this position, but I'm good at handling it.
to: Stresno je delati tukaj na tem položaju, vendar se dobro znajdem.

to: Veterinarja sem poklicala takoj, ko sem opazila, da ptica šepa.

from: I had no doubt.
to: Nisem dvomil.

from: Despite being in a committed relationship, I found it difficult to resist strangers.
to: Kljub temu, da sem bila v predanem razmerju, sem se težko uprla neznancem.

from: I didn't feel affected by criticism at all, I didn't take it personal.
to: Kritike me sploh niso prizadele, nisem jih jemala osebno.

from: I did what they told me to do to fit in.
to: Naredil sem, kar so mi rekli, da sem se vklopil.

from: Taking care of my children is the least I can do for my family.
to: Skrb za svoje otroke je najmanj, kar lahko naredim za svojo družino.

from: My immature mindset prevented me from commiting in a relationship.
to: Moja nezrela miselnost mi je preprečila, da bi se zavezal v zvezi.

from: I’d like to be pretty like Hollywood stars.
to: Rada bi bila lepa kot hollywoodske zvezde.

to: Vedel sem, da se obnaša nesramno, ampak samo zato, ker je imel težko delo.

from: I presented my innovative idea with unwavering conviction.
to: Svojo inovativno idejo sem predstavil z neomajnim prepričanjem.

from: I was never good at sports.
to: Nikoli nisem bil dober v športu.

from: I signed up for a medieval swording workshop.
to: Prijavil sem se na delavnico srednjeveškega mečevanja.

from: My friends have told me that I am empathetic, and I have been very touched by that.
to: Prijatelji so mi rekli, da sem empatična, in to me je zelo ganilo.

from: I had to throw away the hoodie because it had a stain on it that I could not get rid off.
to: Pulover s kapuco sem morala zavreči, ker je imel madež, ki se ga nisem mogla znebiti.

from: I never talked about my feelings with my friends.
to: S prijatelji nikoli nisem govoril o svojih občutkih.

to: Kislih kumaric nisem mogel odpreti, zato sem prosil sostanovalko, naj to stori.

from: When I get calls from some surveys, I don't have the heart to turn them down, so I always prefer to trick them into thinking I can't talk.
to: Ko me pokličejo iz kakšnih anket, jih nimam srca zavrniti, zato jih vedno raje pretentam, da ne morem govoriti.

from: I wasn't happy in Slovakia, even though I didn´t know why. So one day I just packed up and flew to Spain.
to: Na Slovaškem nisem bil srečen, čeprav nisem vedel, zakaj. Tako sem nekega dne le spakiral in odletel v Španijo.

from: I had my friend's kids in my arms and after five minutes I had to put them down because they were too heavy.
to: Imela sem prijateljeve otroke v rokah in po petih minutah sem jih morala odložiti, ker so bili pretežki.

from: I always knew that it's important to have a good skincare routine.
to: Vedno sem vedel, da je pomembno imeti dobro rutino nege kože.

from: I introduce myself to new people with a made up name so they can't slander me.
to: Novim ljudem se predstavljam z izmišljenim imenom, da me ne morejo obrekovati.

from: I tried to be celibate for a month, but I couldn't do it.
to: Poskušal sem biti v celibatu en mesec, a mi ni uspelo.

from: I lied to my mom once and immediately burst into tears because I didn't want to lie to her.
to: Enkrat sem lagala mami in takoj planila v jok, ker ji nisem hotela lagati.

from: I don't like being told how to do my job.
to: Ne maram, da mi govorijo, kako naj opravljam svoje delo.

from: I couldn't listen to those ridiculous conspiracy theories any longer.
to: Nisem mogel več poslušati teh smešnih teorij zarote.

from: I haven't been on a proper shopping spree in a long time.
to: Že dolgo nisem bil na pravem nakupovanju.

from: I don't like to rely on others, I do things best on my own anyway.
to: Ne maram se zanašati na druge, vseeno najbolje naredim stvari sam.

from: I'm so happy it makes me feel guilty.
to: Tako sem vesela, da se počutim krivo.

from: I like to talk openly with employees, I don't have time to waste.
to: Z zaposlenimi se rada odkrito pogovarjam, nimam časa za izgubljanje.

from: I don't want to be financially dependent on anyone.
to: Nočem biti finančno odvisen od nikogar.

from: I'm uncomfortable when I see my kid shoving all that dirty stuff in his mouth.
to: Neprijetno mi je, ko vidim svojega otroka, kako si tlači vse te umazane stvari v usta.

from: I didn't want them to feel bad, so I was quiet.
to: Nisem želel, da bi se počutili slabo, zato sem bil tiho.

from: I couldn't handle it mentally and had to seek a professional help.
to: Psihično tega nisem zdržala in sem morala poiskati strokovno pomoč.

from: Is it okay that I peeked into my partner's phone?
to: Je v redu, da sem pokukal v partnerjev telefon?

from: I've been told to smile more.
to: Rekli so mi, naj se več smejim.

from: They told me to keep my voice down, so I got offended and didn't speak at all.
to: Rekli so mi, naj tiho govorim, zato sem bil užaljen in sploh nisem spregovoril.

from: I'm sure I'll get the job.
to: Prepričan sem, da bom dobil službo.

from: I am happy to provide for my family's basic needs.
to: Z veseljem poskrbim za osnovne potrebe svoje družine.

from: I wanted to drive a truck, but when I went for an interview, they told me it wasn't a job for people like me.
to: Želel sem voziti tovornjak, a ko sem šel na razgovor, so mi rekli, da to ni služba za ljudi, kot sem jaz.

from: I bought LEGO even though I'm an adult.
to: Kupil sem LEGO, čeprav sem odrasel.

from: I get up at four o'clock so I can work out before work.
to: Vstanem ob štirih, da lahko telovadim pred službo.

from: I wanted to go swimming, but I didn't have time to shave my legs.
to: Želel sem plavati, a si nisem imel časa obriti nog.

from: I'm shy and can't keep eye contact.
to: Sem sramežljiva in ne morem držati očesnega stika.

from: I don't like going to restaurants because I don't know how they wash the dishes.
to: Nerad hodim v restavracije, ker ne vem, kako pomivajo posodo.

from: I don't want my partner to work.
to: Nočem, da moj partner dela.

from: Whenever I'm sad, I put on sad songs and it makes me feel even worse.
to: Kadarkoli sem žalosten, zapojem žalostne pesmi in zaradi tega se počutim še slabše.

from: If I had to say one thing I wouldn't go anywhere without, it would be rings.
to: Če bi morala povedati eno stvar, brez katere ne bi šla nikamor, bi bili to prstani.

from: They want me to show emotion, but I've never done that before.
to: Želijo, da pokažem čustva, a tega še nikoli nisem storil.

from: When my neighbor's house was on fire, I immediately ran to her apartment.
to: Ko je gorela sosedova hiša, sem takoj stekel v njeno stanovanje.

from: They asked me if I could help them, and I couldn't say no.
to: Vprašali so me, ali jim lahko pomagam, in nisem mogel reči ne.

from: I vacuum every day, I guess I'm addicted to it.
to: Sesam vsak dan, menda sem od tega odvisna.

from: I'm sore because I was lifting heavy weights yesterday.
to: Hudo mi je, ker sem včeraj dvigoval težke uteži.

from: I don't like to pick flowers, I feel sorry for them.
to: Ne maram trgati rož, smilijo se mi.

from: I could never have a dog, I couldn't stand the hair.
to: Nikoli nisem mogla imeti psa, dlake nisem prenašala.

from: I'm simply the best.
to: Enostavno sem najboljši.

from: I'm addicted to sex.
to: Sem odvisen od seksa.

from: I like expensive clothes because they don't get ruined so quickly.
to: Rada imam draga oblačila, ker se ne uničijo tako hitro.

from: I had to explain to them that I won't tolerate any back talk.
to: Moral sem jim razložiti, da ne bom toleriral nobenih povratnih besed.

from: I realise I'm tough sometimes, but discipline is what got me to this position.
to: Zavedam se, da sem včasih trmast, toda disciplina je tista, ki me je pripeljala do tega položaja.

from: I don't like to beat around the bush.
to: Ne maram premlevanja.

from: I'm looking for a good job so I can give my family what they deserve.
to: Iščem dobro službo, da bom lahko svoji družini dal tisto, kar si zasluži.

from: I found out that when I'm not with my friends, I feel miserable.
to: Ugotovil sem, da se počutim nesrečno, ko nisem s prijatelji.

from: I didn't know how to cook pasta, so I was hungry.
to: Nisem znal skuhati testenin, zato sem bil lačen.

from: They never ask me for help because they say I couldn't handle it.
to: Nikoli me ne prosijo za pomoč, ker pravijo, da tega ne zmorem.

from: I'm hurt, no one has ever treated me like this.
to: Prizadeta sem, še nihče ni tako ravnal z menoj.

from: When I'm hungry, I get grumpy.
to: Ko sem lačen, postanem čemeren.

from: Apparently, I'm the only one who thinks flip-flops are disgusting.
to: Očitno sem edini, ki se mu japonke zdijo odvratne.

from: I never leave things to the last minute, I'm too responsible for that.
to: Nikoli ne puščam stvari za zadnji trenutek, za to sem preveč odgovoren.

from: I had to get a job, or we wouldn't have anything to eat.
to: Moral sem dobiti službo, sicer ne bi imeli kaj jesti.

from: I heard they're opening a new clothing store.
to: Slišal sem, da odpirajo novo trgovino z oblačili.

from: I'm happiest when my whole apartment is tidy.
to: Najsrečnejša sem, ko je moje celotno stanovanje pospravljeno.

from: People around me know that if they need something, I'm happy to help.
to: Ljudje okoli mene vedo, da če kaj potrebujejo, z veseljem pomagam.

from: I don't like gossiping, it's a waste of time.
to: Ne maram ogovarjanja, to je izguba časa.

from: I don't like watching videos of abandoned puppies, it makes me cry.
to: Nerada gledam posnetke zapuščenih kužkov, gre mi na jok.

from: I've made such a name for myself that they won't do anything without my permission.
to: Tako sem si ustvaril ime, da brez mojega dovoljenja ne bodo storili ničesar.

from: I'm too experienced to waste my time here.
to: Preveč sem izkušen, da bi tukaj zapravljal čas.

from: When someone calls me to go out, I'm always happy to say yes.
to: Ko me kdo pokliče, da grem ven, vedno z veseljem pristanem.

from: They say I'm insensitive, but I call it sensible.
to: Pravijo, da sem neobčutljiva, jaz pa temu rečem razumna.

from: People think of me as a wimp just because I'm good to others.
to: Ljudje me imajo za slabca samo zato, ker sem dober do drugih.

from: I wouldn't hurt a fly.
to: Muhe ne bi poškodoval.

from: I'm the only one who does anything in this household.
to: Jaz sem edini, ki kaj počne v tem gospodinjstvu.

from: I don't like to argue with others because I can't hold back my tears.
to: Ne maram se prepirati z drugimi, ker ne morem zadržati solz.

from: I've been waiting so long for this game to come out.
to: Tako dolgo sem čakal na izid te igre.

from: It's hard for me to be new in the city because I don't have any friends here.
to: Težko mi je biti nov v mestu, ker tukaj nimam prijateljev.

from: I couldn't have an office just for myself, I'd go crazy in there.
to: Ne bi mogel imeti pisarne samo zase, tam bi znorel.

from: They always tell me I work a lot, but that's just the way I am.
to: Vedno mi govorijo, da veliko delam, a takšna pač sem.

from: They say what they appreciate most about me is that I'm modest.
to: Pravijo, da pri meni najbolj cenijo to, da sem skromen.

from: I couldn't even open a bottle.
to: Sploh steklenice nisem mogel odpreti.

from: I'm used to coming home from work and play games on PlayStation.
to: Navajen sem prihajati domov iz službe in igrati igre na PlayStationu.

from: Maybe I'm too formal, but I maintain my respect that way.
to: Mogoče sem preveč formalen, a tako ohranjam spoštovanje.

from: I ordered dumbbells that are too heavy and I can't workout with them.
to: Naročil sem uteži, ki so pretežke in z njimi ne morem telovaditi.

from: Sorry about the mess, I didn't get a chance to clean it up.
to: Oprosti za nered, nisem ga imel priložnosti pospraviti.

from: I couldn't set up a business, I need a boss to tell me what to do.
to: Nisem mogel ustanoviti podjetja, potrebujem šefa, da mi pove, kaj naj naredim.

from: I'm the only one qualified for this job.
to: Jaz sem edini kvalificiran za to delo.

from: I'm no beginner to be annoyed because of little things like that.
to: Nisem začetnik, da bi se jezil zaradi takšnih malenkosti.

from: I'm good at combining colours and patterns on clothes.
to: Dobro mi gre kombiniranje barv in vzorcev na oblačilih.

from: Since I've been eating more protein, I feel much stronger.
to: Odkar jem več beljakovin, se počutim veliko močnejšega.

from: I resolved to brush my dog at least three times a week so he wouldn't shed as much.
to: Odločil sem se, da svojega psa skrtačim vsaj trikrat na teden, da ne bi toliko izlil.

from: I'm aware of my qualities.
to: Zavedam se svojih kvalitet.

from: I couldn't stand being cooped up at home for another day.
to: Nisem zdržal, da bi bil zaprt doma še en dan.

from: I'm extremely communicative and love to meet new people.
to: Sem izjemno komunikativna in rada spoznavam nove ljudi.

from: I never thought I'd be the one to turn him in to the police.
to: Nikoli si nisem mislil, da ga bom jaz prijavil policiji.

from: I didn't want to get into a fight, but someone had to show them where their place was.
to: Nisem se hotel kregati, ampak nekdo jim je moral pokazati, kje jim je mesto.

from: I've discovered that the colour of this season is red.
to: Ugotovil sem, da je barva te sezone rdeča.

from: I want to have as much fun with others as possible while I'm young.
to: V mladosti se želim čim bolj zabavati z drugimi.

from: I'm going to the bar tonight, I've been too tense lately.
to: Zvečer grem v lokal, zadnje čase sem preveč napeta.

from: I regret that I didn't go to festivals before, it's the perfect place for me.
to: Žal mi je, da prej nisem hodil na festivale, to je popoln kraj zame.

from: I like to play chess, I've been good at it since I was a kid.
to: Rad igram šah, dober sem že od malega.

from: I've never been afraid of anything and I don't plan to start now.
to: Nikoli me ni bilo ničesar strah in tudi zdaj ne nameravam začeti.

from: I was going to buy a watermelon, but I couldn't manage to take it home.
to: Nameravala sem kupiti lubenico, pa mi je ni uspelo odnesti domov.

from: If I had to, I wouldn't be afraid to face him.
to: Če bi bilo treba, se ne bi bal soočiti z njim.

from: I don't like to judge others.
to: Ne maram obsojati drugih.

from: It's no surprise that I won this election.
to: Ni presenečenje, da sem zmagal na teh volitvah.

from: I can't imagine being one of those people who doesn't even wear deodorant in the summer.
to: Ne morem si predstavljati, da bi bila ena tistih, ki poleti ne uporablja niti dezodoranta.

from: I'm the last one to believe such lies.
to: Jaz sem zadnji, ki verjame takšnim lažem.

from: I could see she wasn't feeling well, so I made her some hot chocolate.
to: Videl sem, da se ne počuti dobro, zato sem ji skuhal vročo čokolado.

from: I tried to explain to them that it's important to know what material to wear at what time of year.
to: Poskušal sem jim razložiti, da je pomembno vedeti, kakšen material nositi v katerem letnem času.

from: I never learned to cook because I didn't have to.
to: Nikoli se nisem naučil kuhati, ker mi ni bilo treba.

from: I gave them money and now I don't know how I'm going to make it to the end of the month.
to: Dal sem jim denar in zdaj ne vem, kako bom zdržal do konca meseca.

from: I didn't want to break up, but I didn't want to show my sensitive side either.
to: Nisem se želela razvezati, a tudi svoje občutljive plati nisem želela pokazati.

from: I babysat my sister's kids last weekend.
to: Prejšnji vikend sem varuhal sestrine otroke.

from: I was in the US for a year and people had no problem talking to me even though they didn't know me.
to: V ZDA sem bil eno leto in ljudje so brez težav govorili z mano, čeprav me niso poznali.

from: I couldn't decide which shirt to buy, so I bought all three.
to: Nisem se mogla odločiti, katero majico kupiti, zato sem kupila vse tri.

from: I'd like to be pretty like Hollywood stars.
to: Rada bi bila lepa kot hollywoodske zvezde.

from: For some reason I wasn't happy, so one day I just packed up and flew to Spain.
to: Iz nekega razloga nisem bil zadovoljen, zato sem nekega dne le spakiral in odletel v Španijo.

from: This make no sense, I screamed.
to: To nima smisla, sem zavpila.

from: Let me lift that for you, I wouldn't be happy if something happened to you.
to: Naj vam to dvignem, ne bi bil vesel, če bi se vam kaj zgodilo.

from: Let me bake the pie, I insisted.
to: Naj spečem pito, sem vztrajal.
